body_html:
I am on windows platform...I did install chocolatey (which installed python 2.7 outside of conda) and then installed bazel which failed because in windows I have msys2_shell.bat (and not msys2.exe)
So a generally futile exercise. I commented out the 5 lines associated with asinh, acosh, cosh, sinh, atanh from basic_gpu_test to make sure that my gpu is playing nicely with tensorflow_gpu.
Thank you for your help though.
Looks like none of these tools (chocolately, bazel and for that matter even CUDA are not meant for Windows. Looks like my next machine must be Ubuntu with CUDA.
Thanks for your help (I think) though.

body:
I am on windows platform...I did install chocolatey (which installed python 2.7 outside of conda) and then installed bazel which failed because in windows I have msys2_shell.bat (and not msys2.exe)
So a generally futile exercise. I commented out the 5 lines associated with asinh, acosh, cosh, sinh, atanh from basic_gpu_test to make sure that my gpu is playing nicely with tensorflow_gpu.
Thank you for your help though.
Looks like none of these tools (chocolately, bazel and for that matter even CUDA are not meant for Windows. Looks like my next machine must be Ubuntu with CUDA.
Thanks for your help (I think) though.
